visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly temperature variations using chronological categorical x-axis labels and continuous y-axis values
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12 monthly observations of temperature values, forming a univariate time series with categorical month labels (nominal scale) and continuous quantitative measurements (interval scale). The provided data shows a non-synthetic annual pattern with summer peak (216.4°F in September) and winter lows (29.9°F in January), maintaining domain validity through seasonally appropriate value ranges. A spline chart was selected to emphasize the continuous progression of temperature changes, maximizing data-ink ratio by removing point markers while preserving the overall trend shape. Verdana/Arial font pairing follows Cairo's accessibility principles for label legibility. The salmon-red color (#FF6347) creates strong figure-ground contrast against the white background, satisfying preattentive processing requirements for quick data localization. Margin allocations prevent axis label truncation while maintaining focus on the central visualization.
